message: wow that's pretty cool
Hey kids, I'm curious if everyone else is waiting for tomorrow or if there's others that already know?
our application was deferred from a previous session, that's how we found out early
We are anxiously waiting. :)
How are you notified?
Apparently they don't get back to applicants until 4/7 (tomorrow) http://www.formspring.me/harjtaggar/q/175642698118624339
@alabut very cool! What is your co?
@vivsinym Same to you!
good luck everybody :)
Do we get a notification either way?
technically it's April 7th...so any time now!
hah! gonna try to get some sleep so I have the energy to act on whatever news we get tomorrow, laters
@vivsinym I am pretty sure you get a notification either way.
@awfy tnx

@wesleyzhao thanks! our app is an email productivity assistant called Stacy - http://stacyplease.com is the boring landing page, I just got back from filming a video shoot at a whiteboard to explain better
PS: I've applied to YC but I haven't got an interview of any questions, so I think that they're not interested to mine too
@ccarnino YC invites you for an interview based on your application, you will know by the end of April 7th if you have been invited to Mountain View for an interview.

I've get involved in the selection of our startup in other incubator. Ussually if they're interested to your application, they ask you some question via email and after they will call you to do an interview. Is YC different?
@awfy Oh, ok! Understood
@pg Do you send an email to each of the founders, or just the founder that filed the application?
@vivsinym We email everyone, unless they neglected to include an email addr in their application.  We'll do it sometime this evening (CA time).
@simonify @pg Thanks!
@kruegerb I think they just send a single email to the one on your HN profile (I think!)
@simonify is right
@ccarnino It doesn't mean anything if we haven't asked any questions.  It looks as if we didn't ask any about 2/3 of the top applications.
http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2420344  Looks like they come out this evening.
@pg How is the quality of the applications this round? It will be difficult to top the W11 round.
no one. wait till this evening to find out.
@aball the person that started this thread apparently has an interview because his entrance was deferred from earlier session.
@pg Thanks Paul for the clarification. My doubt was for my experience with other incubator. I hope to meet you someday
@pg By Bayes' Law getting no questions means your chances go down from p to 2p/(3-p), which means very little but not quite nothing! :)
@karlclement A little better.  It's a little better each time.  The most striking thing was the increase in the *number* of applications.  We got 85% more than 6 months ago.
@pg wow, were you expecting that much of a jump... did it impact the ability for the team to get through the stack in such a short timeframe
@pg YC's been getting a lot of publicity lately, also more and more alumni to spread the good word (that's how i found out in december)
@pg I'm sure Milner bumped the growth some.  I hope the follow-ons don't crowd out good applications. :-/
@flipside true, I'm not sure I would have applied if an alum hadn't encouraged me to.
@jdunck yeah, he totally messed up my winter break, i missed hanging out with friends and spent a few days devouring pg's essays and hacker news (but i'll forgive him for that)
That's what I'm trying to do every day...
@pg I was wondering if there were a way to get you and your team impressed, except create a great product.
@jdunck @flipside Me too. :)
@pg do you look at demo links or videos of all you accept for interviews or do some apps just stand out that you don't need to?
@pg then I think we can safely assume that the number is 2000+ ...
wondering if the number of applications really matters? what i mean is, is the number of accepted groups pre-determined or will they try to fund all promising companies (within reason)?
A close friend of mine had an interview last Friday on Skype.  Not getting an interview early does not mean anything.  We all still have a shot.

Anxiously waiting.  We had one of the judges sign up for our site 7 days back but nobody has came since :(  We're still hopeful though.  If it doesn't happen I'm hacking my bank account until we launch and blow up or get funding from a different incubator.  Time and code shall tell.
Hpw many applications have you received?
If anything, there is massive contention for very few places... that just means that the bridesmaids have value too.
and somebody will try to seek value in the "next 100" after YC takes the first X
what amazes me is how polished many of the applications are already

@YC_hopeful from what I heard TechStars got ~600 applications in the first week, so it's very likely YC is being bombarded, which is unfortunate. I feel like 2 years ago people who really wanted to build a startup, who really couldn't sleep well at night because of their ideas, were the ones to apply to YC. Now, everyone who is unemployed and is half-capable of typing applies to YC, making their job so much harder, and making it so much easier to miss a good deal. What do you think?
I don't think it makes a difference, the good will always rise to the top.
No us
@linuxnow no, just judging based on what people have shown off publicly
@amir are you a reviewer?
If you got denied, its fine... www.LetsMakeAStartup.com is taking  YC people that got denied, and having them team up on a new project!
amir - how do you know that?
Who in SF wants to go get a drink after receiving the rejection email? :P
Hey all, are there any very recent accept/denies?
@pg 85% more?! What was the total this round?
@rrhoover think positive!
http://tantadruj.pen.io/
@citizenkeys Haha, I'm honestly naively optimistic :)

@pg If I recall correctly, you mentioned in one of your posts that there were about 400 good applications that it was hard to tell them exactly why they didn't land an interview. My guess is that the application *number* may have increased dramatically this round, but that the number of good applications is probably about the same.  Is that true?
@pg I recall overhearing that about 20% of the apps were in ALL CAPS during startup school in 2010.  Is that true?
Looks like one lucky team got it already
